meanings.definition: To put a saddle on a horse.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys saddling her horse before going for a ride.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy was saddling up his horse for the rodeo.
meanings.sent3: The horse laughed when she tried saddling it with a tiny toy saddle.
meanings.sent4: Saddling the horse with memories of their adventures together, she felt a pang of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The act of saddling the horse symbolized the beginning of their journey.

meanings.definition: To burden or encumber someone with a responsibility or task.
meanings.sent1: He felt overwhelmed when his boss kept saddling him with extra work.
meanings.sent2: The team leader was saddling the new intern with all the difficult assignments.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but chuckle when her friend tried saddling her with the task of counting all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The weight of responsibility felt like a heavy load saddling his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending tasks kept saddling him, making him feel like Atlas carrying the world.
